content: this legal case involves a dispute over the division of matrimonial property the defendant appealed a judgment from the court of first instance arguing that certain assets acquired during the marriage should not be considered common property however the court of first instance correctly determined that the assets were either acquired through gifts or joint efforts making them coowned property the court relied on factual presumptions outlined in the family code to reach this conclusion the appeal was dismissed and the original judgment was upheld the court ordered the defendant to reimburse the applicant for legal costs and pay interest if the payment is not made within 15 days the defendant is now appealing the judgment claiming errors in the application of the law and assessment of facts they argue that the court imposed an impossible burden of proof and violated their right to equal treatment the court of appeal reviewed the case and dismissed the appeal upholding the judgment of the lower court the appellant is responsible for paying the costs
